description: Even in this early stage, it open, show chats and allows to work with them. Didn't test calls. Scales properly for phones with phosh ( xiaomeme note 9, 1+6 ) on droidian and pmos ( 1+6 ). Only problem I have, is that this client doesn't download icons and its hard to find youself

app scaling is so important to me. as severs have so much going on. even with collapsable sidebars and code blocks being able to scale not just the text but the UI. I'm surpised it doesn't read my tweaks settings.

This discord client has really improved alot in the past few years, and for a basic little discord client it is a pretty good option. It might not replace your full-fledged client but if your needs are more basic, it will do great while looking great.

Pros:
- Easily the best looking discord client bar none, stunning and integrates beautifully with GNOME
- Has pretty much every chat feature I use
- Lighter on resources than electron/web clients, and noticeably faster
- Uses system native emojis wherever possible
- In active development with features being added at lightning pace

Cons: (and feature requests)
- Dark mode only (for now)
- Does not display status indicators (i.e Online, DND, Offline, ect)
- Does not run in the background
- No voice chat support (although most third-party non-electron/web based ones don't)
summary: a stunningly beautiful discord client with a basic feature set

description: It offers all the functionality that I need and is blazingly fast compared to the Web-based clients.
summary: This Discord client is just enough for me. Blazingly fast
